item.title: Psychedelics are not all sunshine and rainbows, leaving me with impaired cognition
item.description:
in Serious Emotional Problems

@FeelSpaghetti There are many other factors for decreased cognition, brain fog, etc. You should research them. For example, heavy metals definitely impair cognition very significantly.

Consider the possibility that your issue may not be the psychedelics but other factors which simply got conflated with your psychedelic use. There is no reason why psychedelics should ruin your cognition rather than enhance it.

You need to run tests on all those other factors, which you can correct and cure to get your cognition back. Don't just accept that it is ruined forever. You have remarkable capacities to heal if you get serious about it.

Clean up your diet, get blood work, check your hormones, check your heavy metals, try various supplements, try detox protocols, etc.

item.title: Joseph Campbell Quote
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Joseph Campbell never experienced a truly psychotic state of consciousness.

It is not the the same as a mystical enlightenment.

It's a moot point to say that the waters are the same because it's all Consciousness. But Consciousness can take some radical states.

You swim in the same waters as a kangaroo and a glass of orange juice. But that will not console you if you find yourself turned into a glass of orange juice.

item.title: The Gravel Institute - The Leftist Alternative to PragerU
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

It's not like PragerU invented some new type of video. Short education videos have been all the rage on YT for years. For example, Vox has many great, short, snappy, educational political videos with a left-wing progressive POV.

Like so:

Such videos, when done well and without a hidden religious or ideological motive (like PragerU) are very good and important for educating the public.

See, Vox and PragerU are not just opposite sides of the same coin. Vox is more truthful, more conscious, more selfless, more compassionate. Blue vs Green.

It's not simply a matter of "bias". It's a matter of intellectual honesty, truthfulness, and accuracy. Vox has an obvious left-wing bias, but they are much more truthful and accurate than PragerU -- which pumps out horseshit ideology using "experts" like Ben Shapiro, Jordan Peterson, and Dave Rubin. PragerU's "experts" are ideological hacks and grifters, not serious academics, intellectuals, scientists, or historians.

Robert Reich has been doing Gravel Institute -like videos for a while now:

 

The big difference is that PragerU videos are funded by huge billionaire money. It's pure astroturfing. They run ads like crazy to get their high views. The left-wing does not have that so much. Progressive videos are more organic because there's not a lot of money to be made from propagandizing tens of millions of people into progressive policies.

item.title: Is there any correlation between entlightment & compassion?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
3 hours ago, Arzola said:

Is that possible? 

Survival still demands identifying with something...

Maybe “to study the self is to forget the self“?

Let me rephrase:

Once you realize the self is illusory, you will do less selfish shit. Because much of selfish action is sourced by a blind belief in the importance of the self.

This does not mean you will be perfectly selfless. Merely that you will have a tendency to be less selfish.

item.title: How does fear not exist?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

It is much like walking into a dark room and fearing the snake you see in the corner, only to turn on the lights and realize the snake was a rope.

Your sensation and experience of fear was as real as the rope and the room. But it was based on a false interpretation.

Saying that fear is false does not mean the sensation of fear doesn't exist or isn't happening. It obviously is.

All sensations exist. The pertinent question is, what is their significance and why are they arising in you?

item.title: Is DMSA a supplement or a drug?
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition

Mercury level of tuna: 0.35 PPM

Mercury level of mackerel: 0.05 PPM

Mercury level of salmon: 0.02 PPM

Mercury level of beef: 0.003 PPM

Mercury level of pork: 0.002 PPM

Mercury level of chicken: 0.001 PPM

FDA official toxic dose of mercury: 0.1 µg mercury/kg body weight/day

0.1ug x 81kg (175lbs) = 8.1 ug/day

16oz salmon = 453g x 0.02ug/g = 9.06 ug

1 pound of salmon > FDA's toxic daily dose of mercury. And their daily doses are utterly high.

Each pound of salmon you eat contains a daily dose of mercury poisoning. And salmon is one of the least toxic fish.

item.title: R.I.P. Ruth Bader Ginsburg, 87
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
19 minutes ago, Akemrelax said:

Even if we excuse Facebook ignoring its hate speech policy, it's hard to excuse Facebook closing opposition pages and accounts just before last year's elections. 

"Just before last year’s general elections to the Lok Sabha [lower house], Facebook took down 702 pages and users: 687 of these were linked to the Congress [a political party, not the legislative body] , punished for not disclosing their links to the party, according to information released by the company last year. But Facebook took no comparable action against those with undisclosed affiliations with the BJP."

It's hard to believe Facebook is getting by without colluding in a country like India. 

The reason they do that is for the same reason corporations and capitalists support facist regimes. Because being in the good graces of those in power maximizes profits.

If they don't favor the BJP, the BJP might block Facebook's access to India, giving some competitor's platform the state's support.

A corporation does not want to get on the shit list of the party in power.

item.title: R.I.P. Ruth Bader Ginsburg, 87
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
14 minutes ago, Akemrelax said:

The topic is incongruent to this thread, it deserves it's own thread, but here are some sources: 

  1. "Ms. Das [Facebook Public Policy Head for India, South and Central Asia] has provided the BJP with favorable treatment on election-related issues, current and former employees said." Ankhi Das has strong ties with the BJP (India's ruling party). 
    • https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-hate-speech-india-politics-muslim-hindu-modi-zuckerberg-11597423346
  2. "Her presence seemed to open any door, a Facebook executive told me. 'We used to joke that it was like she [Ankhi Das] was Modi’s granddaughter.'"
    • https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/may/12/facebook-free-basics-india-zuckerberg?CMP=share_btn_tw
  3. "If Facebook’s handling of the BJP with kid gloves is subtle, more visible is its well-entrenched, commercially beneficial relationship with the Narendra Modi government in India, the company’s biggest market with 340 million users. Facebook has programming collaborations with at least eight different government ministries and departments."
    • https://www.article-14.com/post/inside-facebook-s-bjp-bond-key-tie-ups-with-modi-govt-its-special-interests
  4. It's hard to moderate your customers, there is a conflict of interest. "BJP tops political ad spend on Facebook India. Among the top 10 spenders in this category are four other advertisers who are linked to the BJP, including three that share the same address in Delhi as the ruling party's national headquarters, according to the tracker." 
    • https://indianexpress.com/article/india/facebook-india-ad-money-bjp-congress-6571461/
  5. Facebook fires employee exposing right-wing bias.
    • https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/craigsilverman/facebook-zuckerberg-what-if-trump-disputes-election-results?bfsource=relatedmanual
  6. Facebook's policies lead to violence:
    • https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/bengaluru-three-killed-in-police-firing-as-mobs-riot-mlas-kin-held-for-facebook-post/articleshow/77515499.cms
    • (another story like one above) https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/21/world/asia/facebook-sri-lanka-riots.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article

In the US, the congressional hearings last year shed light on the Facebook policy of not factchecking political ads ahead of the 2020 election. I think this is a problem in the US to a lesser degree as well. Why would it not be? Lol This is so predictable.

Good sources.

There seems to be plenty of devilry going on inside Facebook.
